wikipedia_page.main: Sir Augustus William Lawson Hemming  (2 September 1841 – 27 March 1907) was a British colonial administrator, who acted as governor of a number of colonies, including British Guiana (1896-1898) and Jamaica (1898-1904).In April 1902, Sir Augustus Hemming (as governor of Jamaica) and Lady Hemming visited Cuba as guests of Military Governor Leonard Wood.Hemming was also a first-class cricketer. He played six first-class matches: five for various teams in England between 1866 and 1878, and one in 1902 when he was Governor of Jamaica and aged 60.
